image.altText: Australia's Defence Minister and Disability Minister Linda Reynolds speaks during a press conference in Washington, July 2020.

props.synopsis: The WA Senator filed her latest lawsuit in Western Australia's Supreme Court on Monday and is seeking an apology and damages.

title.children: Liberal Senator Linda Reynolds sues the ACT government and its former top prosecutor for defamation

image.altText: A man being led by police officers from a car.

props.synopsis: Sixty-eight-year-old Joseph Vekony is the second Melbourne man allegedly involved in a violent 1999 Canberra home invasion with an elderly couple beaten before a woman died at the scene.

title.children: Second Melbourne man arrested over 1999 cold case murder of Canberra woman

image.altText: An artists impression showing London Circuit and Commonwealth Avenue.

props.synopsis: The next stage of Canberra's light rail project is a 1.7-kilometre extension to Commonwealth Park. By the time it opens, it will have been more than eight years since the last stage was completed.

title.children: 'Five years for 1.7 kilometres': ACT government defends its handling of the next light rail stage which experts say is too slow

image.altText: A man with a septum piercing and white beard and long hair wearing a beanie outside while it snows

props.synopsis: ABC Investigations has uncovered the extensive digital footprints of Donald Day Jr, who was charged in connection to a deadly shooting in Wieambilla, Queensland. His posting history reveals a conspiratorial worldview where violence is inevitable.

title.children: Inside the god-fearing and extremist world of Donald Day Jr

image.altText: heat map of the east coast of Australia

props.synopsis: Temperatures exceeding 40 degrees Celsius will grip parts of the country this weekend, sparking fires and major warnings.

title.children: Heatwaves across the country this weekend will see temperatures reach the 40s in some states

image.altText: A dust storm at a farm.

props.synopsis: Firefighters and water bombers have been deployed to contain multiple bushfires across South Australia with temperatures already surpassing 40 degrees Celsius in some parts of the state.

title.children: More than 20,000 without power as SA emergency services battle 'catastrophic fire conditions'

image.altText: Severe Tropical Cyclone Jasper, a category 4 system, is moving to the south through the northeastern Coral Sea

props.synopsis: Cyclone Jasper intensifies to a category four system, continuing its gradual march towards the north Queensland coast.

title.children: Disaster coordinators prepare for Tropical Cyclone Jasper to make landfall as system intensifies to category four

image.altText: Two people silhouetted by a blazing yellow sun against a firey red backdrop.

props.synopsis: The startling heat records come as large parts of Australia are set to endure heatwave conditions, with temperatures expected to reach over 40 degrees in some places.

title.children: As Australia is gripped by a heatwave, 2023 is declared the hottest year on record

image.altText: Jon Rahm smiles and gives a thumbs up while posing with Greg Norman

props.synopsis: The hundreds of millions being paid to Jon Rahm to leave the PGA Tour and join LIV Golf is about more than poaching one of the world's best players. It's about power and leverage in a negotiation that will shape the future of the game.

title.children: With the stroke of a pen, Jon Rahm might have just crushed the PGA Tour

image.altText: Orange flames and thick black smoke billow from a burning factory.

props.synopsis: Residents in Dandenong South are urged to shelter indoors immediately as firefighters battle to contain a blaze at a paint factory fire, which has sent thick smoke over nearby suburbs.

title.children: One person 'unaccounted for' in factory fire in Melbourne's south-east

image.altText: Baldur's Gate, Super Mario Bros. Wonder and Resident Evil 4 were all nominated for Game Of The Year.

props.synopsis: Actors Matthew McConaughey and Timothée Chalamet made feature appearances at the video game industry's night of nights.

title.children: Game Awards 2023 winners list: Kojima reveals new game with Jordan Peele, Baldur's Gate 3 sweeps awards

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank remains confident that very few borrowers — less than 2 per cent — are at serious risk of defaulting on their mortgages despite the sharpest rise in interest rates in more than three decades.

title.children: RBA finds 5pc of mortgage borrowers spend more than they earn, but not worried about default risks

image.altText: A man in winter coat and scarf in front of a mountain and building.

props.synopsis: A former Yorke Peninsula teacher who groomed multiple students has been sentenced to 14 years in prison, with a judge describing his apology as an "insincere insult" to his young victims.

title.children: Former SA teacher who groomed students on Snapchat jailed for child sex offences

image.altText: A man displaying a large fish he has caught.

props.synopsis: Matthew Jones, 39, was arrested as part of Victoria Police's Viper Taskforce investigation into organised crime and drug trafficking.

title.children: KFC franchisee charged with trafficking cocaine, other drug offences

image.altText: Methamphetamine pictured next to pillows

props.synopsis: Three Perth men, including the grandson of a former West Australian premier, are each sentenced to more than 13 years in jail over a plot to import methamphetamine worth up to $159 million into the country.

title.children: Grandson of former WA premier among trio jailed over plot to import 99kg of meth hidden in latex pillows

image.altText: Hunter Biden, dressed in a suit, is seen outside.

props.synopsis: The son of US President Joe Biden faces up to 17 years if he is convicted on the charges, which cover four years between 2016 and 2019.

title.children: Hunter Biden hit with accusations of failing to pay $2.1 million in taxes

image.altText: A building with a logo for Santos on it

props.synopsis: A surge in Santos shares helped to lift the ASX higher for the week, while the federal government struck a fresh agreement with the Reserve Bank about how it conducts monetary policy. As it happened.

title.children: Jobs market gets worse, RBA strikes new deal with government, ASX gains on Santos surge — as it happened

image.altText: Mr Fransen smiling with lizard

props.synopsis: More than 600 people including top emergency officials gather to farewell 75-year-old RFS captain Leo Fransen, who's been remembered as a generous, loving and loyal father who was a dedicated volunteer.

title.children: 'It still doesn't seem real': Fallen volunteer firefighter farewelled by devastated family

image.altText: A shopping trolley full of essentials items like fruit, water, and eggs

props.synopsis: A year-long parliamentary inquiry focused on the future of Australia's food security recommends introducing a minister for food among its 35 recommendations to the federal government.

title.children: Minister for food proposed as farmers seek accountability for 'avalanche of bad ideas'

image.altText: Men dressed in black walk into an office with Vote Yes posters in their arms

props.synopsis: Disturbing vision emerges of white supremacists wearing balaclavas storming the South Australian Premier's electorate office in protest of the state Voice to Parliament. Warning: This story contains offensive and racist themes.

title.children: Video emerges of men performing Nazi salute in SA Premier's office

image.altText: A peach-coloured dandelion on a soft, sunset backdrop

props.synopsis: Each year since 1999, a colour-matching company has declared a very specific shade as the colour for the upcoming year. Next year, it'll be Peach Fuzz.

title.children: You might be seeing a lot more of this colour next year. Here's why

image.altText: Picture of a high school

props.synopsis: A teenager accused of injuring a fellow student with a sharp weapon at a Perth high school is ordered to remain in custody after a brief appearance in court.

title.children: Teenager accused of injuring fellow Perth school student with sharp weapon held in custody

image.altText: An Israeli tank operates near the Israel-Gaza border.

props.synopsis: Israel battles Hamas militants in the Gaza Strip's biggest cities, with hundreds more Palestinians killed and almost 2 million displaced Palestinians struggling to find safe refuge amid critical shortages of food and shelter. Follow live.

title.children: UN aid chief says there are no functioning humanitarian operations left in southern Gaza

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: War claims more journalists than any conflict in more than 30 years, says IFJ
No functioning humanitarian operations left in southern Gaza
Images, videos surface of men stripped with hands tied in Gaza

image.altText: David Warner looks to one side surrounded by his teammates

props.synopsis: David Warner has played a perfect forward defence after comments from former teammate Mitchell Johnson criticising the Test opener's farewell tour.

title.children: David Warner has his say after Mitchell Johnson criticism

image.altText: Emma Walters appears serious, dressed in a white jacket as she walks along a street in Melbourne's CBD.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne magistrate finds Emma Walters guilty of making a threat to kill her estranged husband, CFMEU boss John Setka, but does not recorded a conviction against her, and instead imposed a fine of $1,500.

title.children: Emma Walters fined $1,500 over threat to kill estranged husband John Setka

image.altText: A composite image of a man and a car.

props.synopsis: Liquidators will sell reality TV star Teddy Briggs's prized Mercedes-Benz as part of their efforts to claw back more than $600,000 owed to creditors of his online business.

title.children: Reality star's Mercedes-Benz to be sold off to help pay debts after business goes into liquidation

image.altText: A mine near Broken Hill at sunset with the horizon and the city.

props.synopsis: While the future of one of Broken Hill's major mines is still uncertain, a green energy storage project to be built in the coming years may provide employment opportunities for some of the displaced workers.

title.children: Hundreds of jobs on horizon after green light for first-of-its-kind energy project

image.altText: Meshilin Marrogi smiles in front of a graphic of a blue sky.

props.synopsis: Police issue a targeted call for information over a gruesome casket break-in where two men stole a diamond ring off the body of Meshilin Marrogi, the sister of underworld figure George Marrogi.

title.children: Police ask underworld figures 'outraged' by revenge casket break-in to come forward

image.altText: A front facade of a Countdown store has green Woolworths-like branding.

props.synopsis: Australia is likely to have a Senate inquiry into supermarket giants Coles and Woolworths next year, but across the ditch there are lessons about how hard it is to disrupt a duopoly.

title.children: NZ has already held a supermarket study. Did it disrupt its duopoly?

image.altText: Tasmanian Judge Gregory Geason

props.synopsis: Tasmania's chief justice texted a Supreme Court judge who is charged with criminal offences suggesting he could "resign" to avoid facing an inquiry to determine his future tenure.

title.children: Leaked text shows chief justice telling judge he could 'resign before this goes further'

image.altText: Toddler Tarrin-Macen O’Sullivan smiling and wearing a hat while on a swing.

props.synopsis: A woman has been arrested after allegedly murdering her four-year-old child two years ago in North Queensland.

title.children: North Queensland woman charged with murder over four-year-old son's death

image.altText: La Sagrada Familia in Barcelona with a crane near one of the towers

props.synopsis: Antoni Gaudí's La Sagrada Família Basilica in Barcelona still has no firm completion date 140 years after construction started. This is what it's like trying to carry on the visionary's legacy.

title.children: 'An impossible dream': What it's like building Barcelona's La Sagrada Família 140 years on
